DataElement.preferredName: Diarrhea Greater than or Equal to CTCAE Grade 3 During Current Cycle Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator of whether or not the patient had diarrhea greater than or equal to CTCAE Grade 3 during the current treatment cycle.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Diarrhea Greater Than or Equal To Severe Adverse Event During Current Therapy Cycle
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Watery bowel movements._A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways._An adverse event experience that requires intensive therapeutic intervention and interrupts usual daily activities._At some point in a given period of time._The name of the therapy that is currently being administered._An event or sequence of events that constitute a round or succession of observable phenomena, recurring usually at regular or approximately regular time intervals and in the same sequence.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A condition of frequent and watery bowel movements.

Property.preferredName: Greater Than or Equal To Severe Adverse Event During Current Therapy Cycle
Property.preferredDefinition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways.:An adverse event experience that requires intensive therapeutic intervention and interrupts usual daily activities.:At some point in a given period of time.:The name of the therapy that is currently being administered.:An event or sequence of events that constitute a round or succession of observable phenomena, recurring usually at regular or approximately regular time intervals and in the same sequence.

Concepts.definition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways.
An adverse event experience that requires intensive therapeutic intervention and interrupts usual daily activities.
At some point in a given period of time.
The name of the therapy that is currently being administered.
An event or sequence of events that constitute a round or succession of observable phenomena, recurring usually at regular or approximately regular time intervals and in the same sequence.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the outcome or resolution of the patient's adverse events.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for MHRI GU IRB# 2015-0547: HALT-D protocol, Bowel Movement Endpoint form. 6/6/17 mc

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Did the patient have diarrhea
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient have diarrhea GRADE > =3 during this cycle (refer to CTCAE grading below)?
